newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks end down in dull trading.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks end down in dull trading.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended down on Thursday in lacklustre trading as institutions and investors kept to the sidelines on new accounts day, and dealers said the index would remain range-bounded in the near term.
"There was not much activity as major players continued to stay out," dealer Hina Akhlaq said. "Activity revolved around select speculative scrips," deaker Shakil Anwar said.
The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index fell 6.23 points, or 0.41 percent, to end at 1,519.69. Losers led gainers 179 to 60. Hub Power fell 0.30 to 37 rupees.
